meanings.definition: The hind part of a saddle.
meanings.sent1: The cantle of the saddle provides support for the rider.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the cantle of the saddle before mounting the horse.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide nuts under the cantle of the saddle.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the cantle of the saddle cast a long shadow on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The worn leather of the cantle creaked softly with each movement.

meanings.definition: A corner or piece of something.
meanings.sent1: He found a cantle of cheese left on the plate.
meanings.sent2: The cantle of the puzzle was missing, making it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent3: She carefully placed a cantle of ribbon on top of the gift.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a hidden cantle where spiders liked to build their webs.
meanings.sent5: The cantle of the broken vase lay scattered on the floor.

meanings.definition: To cut off the corner or edge of something.
meanings.sent1: She had to cantle the fabric to make it fit the pattern.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed to cantle the vegetables for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally cantled the paper while trying to trim it neatly.
meanings.sent4: The tailor would cantle the excess material to create a perfect fit.
meanings.sent5: In woodworking, it is important to cantle precisely to avoid mistakes.
